alert.note: Alert for Northern Craven; Pitt; Southern Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 7:57PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jones, northwestern Craven, southeastern Pitt and western Pamlico Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 757 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Barnwell, or 16 miles southeast of Ayden, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Bern, River Bend, Vanceboro, Askins, Fort Barnwell, Jasper, Tuscarora, Rhems, Ernul and Cove City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.
